dialogues.DEAN:
[1]Mr. Armitage will do. 
[2]I got him. Come here. 
[3]Call me Dean. We hug around here, Fella. 
[4]My wife Missy. 
[5]"Wow" is good. We'll take wow. 
[6]It ought to be. Lord knows we've done enough work on it through the years... 
[7]You know what I say. One down... a few hundred thousand to go. 
[8]What?! Those things are everywhere up here, Chris; like rats. The damage they've done to the ecology alone... Anyway, are we ready for the grand tour? 
[9]Leave `em. Walter will get `em. 
[10]Frankenstein's monster. Only pieces of the original structure remain; I like to think the soul is in tact though. 
[11]There are seven bedrooms, ten bathrooms, three indoor dining areas, two study's, two main kitchens. There's an observatory wing on the top floor. And you'd be hard pressed to find a room that doesn't serve as library. 
[12]That's Jeremy. Rose's brother. He's in Med school. 
[13]He went through a couple dark spots but came out the other side. You'll meet him later. 
[14]Mother and Father lived here till the end. They died a few years ago now. Passed away within weeks of each other... 
[15]"Love" is a powerful thing. 
[16]My Dad was a runner. A good runner; great sprinter. 
[17]Oh, In fact, you might find this interesting, he was just beat out by Jessie Owens in the qualifying round for the `36 Olympics in Berlin. That's the one where-- 
[18]You know your history. 
[19]Of course. One of those perfect moments. There's Hitler on his high horse with his perfect Aryan race, and here comes this black guy to prove him wrong on the world's stage. What a moment. 
[20]He almost got over it. 
[21]Okay Snowbell just looking. Missy's office. This is where she takes appointments. 
[22]Yeah. One of the best in the world. Not a tidy woman. 
[23]A neurosurgeon; was. I retired early. Now, I pretty much focus on the house and twiddle my thumbs. 
[24]Oh, downstairs is the wine cellar, the games room, some storage. Apparently a black mold issue down there. Almost everything needs to get thrown out; shame. 
[25]My mother loved her kitchen. 
[26]Oh, Georgina, this is Chris; Rose's boyfriend. 
[27]Ah ha! But now for the piece de resistance... 
[28]Badminton and bocce ball, croquet; we're a family who loves games. Two other families have properties on lake Pontaco, and they're way on the other side. Total privacy. 
[29]I know what you're thinking. 
[30]Well-to-do white family; black servants... 
[31]You didn't have to. We hired them a few years ago to help care for my parents; they became part of the family. Couldn't bear to let them go. I hate the way it makes us look though... 
[32]Yeah. 
[33]Well, crap. Walter! 
[34]Another dead bird! Damn things fly into the patio from time to time; break their necks. 
[35]Iced tea? 
[36]`Atta boy Chris. Get used to saying that. 
[37]Can't resist the inevitable. 
[38]Ah, yes. 
[39]Uh oh. Get out of here before it's too late! 
[40]Oh no! A smoker!? 
[41]You should have Missy take care of that for you. 
[42]Hypnosis. Works like a charm. 
[43]I thought the whole thing was B.S. too. I smoked for 20 years. She puts me under once, now the sight of a cigarette makes me wanna vomit. 
[44]A tradition. Some of my Dad's old social club. Some old patients. Some just friends... 
[45]Jeremy's home. 
[46]Manners, Rose. Give the guest what he wants. 
[47]Okay, new subject. Chris, Yanks or Mets? 
[48]She's right. Let someone else talk for a bit. 
[49]--Alright, enough Jeremy! 
[50]Hello! 
[51]Achem! Once again, I want to thank you all for coming. Words cannot express how much it means to us that after all these years we can all still get together and share. I'm reminded of stories of how the knights of old would gather in honor of a new crusade... 
[52]Chris! There you are. I wanted to introduce you to some old friends. We'll do it quickly. Down the line: David and Marcia Wincott, Ronald and Celia Jeffries, Hiroki Tanaka, and Fredrich and Jessika Walden. 
[53]Of course. 
[54]It was a seizure. 
[55]Yes. Logan's okay. Missy's with him now. Are you okay Chris? 
[56]It was an abnormal manifestation but yes, actually, sometimes they do. The flash on your phone must have triggered it. 
[57]It's a simple glitch of the brain. Nothing to be afraid of. 
[58]Of course. 
[59]Let's do sparklers shall we? Brighten the mood? 
[60]What is your purpose, Chris? 
[61]In life? What is your purpose..? 
[62]We've been looking for our purpose for such a long time. Fire has mesmerized man since the Stone Age. It is a reflection of our impermanence in the world. Fire is born, it breathes and then it dies. 
[63]There's a reason we worship the Sun, Chris. He who lights the way through the darkness of life. He in all his glory was around long before us and will be here long after we are gone, but he too will die some day! That's right even the Sun God will die. It is no less mortal than we, but it inspires us to defy it! So what do we do?-- 
[64]--What do we do?! We baptize ourselves in the firewater! 
[65]We bathe in his reflection, for one chance to emerge having defied death! 
[66]You'd take that baptism wouldn't you, Chris? The baptism of immortality? 
[67]Listen, Chris-- 
[68]
[69]He hit his head pretty good. 
[70]It's important to me that they acknowledge the purpose. 
[71]You're going to drop him. 
[72]Saw... 
[73]The vessel. 
[74]Jeremy...? 
[75]Ro Ro...? 
[76]
dialogues.MISSY:
[1]We miss you, Ro Ro. 
[2]Yes, you'll do just fine. So handsome. 
[3]Of course, come inside, make yourself at home. 
[4]How was the ride in? 
[5]Are you guys okay? 
[6]I bet. 
[7]Let them unload their bags first. 
[8]Rose tells us your parents aren't with us. 
[9]You two seem like you've been together for years. How long has it been now? 
[10]Not a lot of time, anyway. So...? You guys in love or what? 
[11]Yep. You're in love. I can tell. 
[12]And how did you meet, again? 
[13]And he really is so good looking, isn't he? You'd have beautiful babies. 
[14]And we were just beginning to like you. 
[15]Of course, I'd give you the service for free. You are family after all. 
[16]If you change your mind... We're just glad you could join us for the big get-together. 
[17]Oh, well we host a shindig once a year for our friends. 
[18]Drinks, good food, good people... 
[19]Georgina! 
[20]It's fine George, I'll get it. Maybe you need a nap. 
[21]Jeremy... 
[22]No you weren't. Were you? 
[23]Uch. 
[24]I'm going to see how dessert is coming along. Maybe we can change the conversation to something a little lighter. 
[25]What'd I miss? 
[26]No karate at the dinner table. 
[27]Quick fix? 
[28]Come. Let's nip this in the bud. 
[29]There really is no need to be nervous. 
[30]Walter starts early every day. He's borderline obsessive compulsive. Tea? 
[31]How's the bed. Good? 
[32]Comfortable enough? 
[33]Enough sheets? 
[34]You watch a lot of Television. Now, you are feeling very sleeepy... 
[35]We do use focal points sometimes, but just about any object or simple motion can guide someone to a state of heightened suggestibility. 
[36]Your childhood. 
[37]Wounds get locked in your heart and they fester and grow into ugly little things like depression and addiction. But, they are all in there somewhere. All we need to do is find the key. 
[38]--we're going to go back to a place that might be uncomfortable for you. Your Mother's death to be specific. Were you there when she was hit? 
[39]Let's go back there. Hear this place. Let the vibrations rush run through your body and ears. Hear it... Find it... Tell me when you find it. 
[40]Good. How did you find out she died? 
[41]Good. Now touch. Feel your surroundings. Feel every part of your body and what you touched. Feel it. Find it... Tell me when you find it... 
[42]Tell me when you find it. 
[43]You said `you knew something was wrong.' What did you do? 
[44]Nothing? 
[45]You didn't call someone? Your Aunt or the police? 
[46]Why not? 
[47]Next is smell and taste. Breathe in and let the scent fill your nose. Smell that place. Taste it. Find it. 
[48]Tell me. Tell me when you find it. 
[49]Good. Now lastly, you must see it. Let the light flood into your eyes. Every color, every detail. See it. See it. Find it. 
[50]Tell me when-- 
[51]You think it was your fault. 
[52]I want you to feel that fear again, Chris. 
[53]It's okay. I'm here. 
[54]Are you afraid now? Paralyzed like that day? 
[55]Good. Now sink into the floor. 
[56]Sink! Now! 
[57]Good. Good. Sink. Sink. 
[58]Now you are in the Sunken Place. 
[59]We're just glad you're feeling yourself again. 
[60]Anybody need a drink? 
[61]I just made tea. 
[62]You're leaving us. 
[63]Is something wrong? 
[64]Don't hurt him, Jeremy. 
[65]Is he hurt? 
[66]Why do you push them, Dean? 
[67]Why do you think he ran? 
[68]Take him to the games room. Jeremy, get the legs. Dean, help him. 
[69]No. We've already damaged him enough. Dean, please. 
[70]Be careful what you say, everyone. He can hear every word.
dialogues.JEREMY:
[1]Who answers the door around here?! 
[2]One more... So, let me set the scene. I'm a junior; Ro's a freshman and she has a crush on this guy Connor-- 
[3]Yeah, Rose. 
[4]Connor Garfield was on my lacrosse team. Huge guy, like 6'3", and crazy, just like "Looney Tunes," right? We had thrown a party-- 
[5]I think my parents were in Greece or something. We had gotten into their liquor cabinet and we're all shit-faced. 
[6]We put water in the bottles so you wouldn't know. Let me finish. Okay, so I'm upstairs in my parents' bathroom hooking up with Jenny Richardson. Hottest girl in our class. 
[7]Thanks. All of a sudden Connor starts banging on the bathroom door, right? I open it, and he's got blood gushing out of his mouth and he's screaming "Your thith-ter bit my fuckin' thongue off!!!!" 
[8]Sure enough, there is a centimeter of tongue meat missing right here. 
[9]You an MMA fan? 
[10]What? 
[11]You've had your chance. He's dating my sister. I can't bond with the guy? 
[12]You ever get into street fights as a kid? 
[13]Cause, with your frame, your genetic make-up? If you pushed your body, I mean really trained, you'd be a beast. 
[14]We're talking about sports. Stand up. Let me show you something. 
[15]It's not karate, it's jiu-jitsu. 
[16]
[17]I wasn't going to hurt him. 
[18]Chris, we need you... 
[19]HA! Come on. You can do better than that! 
[20]Yeah, I see that. 
[21]I'm just saying, if your boy isn't gonna bring his `A' game, we might as well bring Mom up here. 
[22]See, that's what I'm talking about!!! Okay, again! 
[23]Where are you going? The party's just getting started. 
[24]Whoa! Be careful, bro. 
[25]What? I'm not doing anything. 
[26]Oh shit! 
[27]Did you see him drop? 
[28]Rose gave it away. 
[29]I can take him alone. 
[30]No I'm not. 
[31]Ahhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!! 
[32]Grandma!!!! 
[33]Grampa! 
[34]Get him!!! 
[35]Kill him, Grandpa. 
[36]What...? Grandpa--? 
[37]Ahhhhhh!
dialogues.JIM:
[1]Ignorant shit... 
[2]All of them. Ignorant assholes. They have no idea what real people go through. 
[3]Heh. No, you're right. And usually not even that much. That's people. 
[4]Jim Hudson. 
[5]I know who you are. I'm an admirer of your work; you have a great eye... 
[6]The irony of being a blind art dealer isn't lost on me. 
[7]I have an assistant describe work to me. You've got something... The images you capture... so brutally melancholic. Powerful stuff. 
[8]I used to dabble myself. Wilderness mostly. I submitted to Nat Geo 14 times before realizing I didn't have "the eye" for it; Began dealing. And then, of course, my vision went to shit. 
[9]I know. Life can be a sick joke. One day you're working in a dark room, and the next day - BAM. You wake up in the dark. Genetic disease. 
[10]Yeah. 
[11]Stop by the gallery some time. Bout time you had a solo show. 
[12]I think we could do wonderful things together. 
[13]Hello Chris. How's it going...? You can answer. There's an intercom in the room; I can hear you. 
[14]Yeah, sorry about that. If it makes you feel any better, I'm thirsty too. 
[15]Right. So, the reason I am talking to you now is so you can understand what is happening to you. I guess your `understanding' it raises the success rate of this whole thing. Not even sure I `understand' it. 
[16]Hot isn't she? Hot voice anyway, you dirty dog. You're one of the lucky one's. The son Jeremy's wrangling method sounds way less pleasant. 
[17]They asked me for my favorite song, which was hard; I like all types of music. Turns out they really just needed one I knew all the words to: I went with James Taylor's "You Got a Friend." I hope it hasn't been too torturous; that wasn't the point. The point is that you learn it, and for us to have that knowledge in common. 
[18]Oh right. Okay, let me back up and give you the cliff notes. The Armitages and I are a part of a society. A pretty extraordinary society actually. 
[19]One whose sole purpose for many many years has been a search for a very powerful object. Armitage lineage redefined the nature of that search. They proved that the power didn't just exist in that object; You see, with science the Armitage's created a miracle. 
[20]No. Not racist, Chris. We don't hate you. We want to be you... You are not going to be a slave. You're going to be a vessel. 
[21]Missy's hypnosis was merely to sedate you. Oh, that and to prepare you psychologically... 
[22]For the procedure. 
[23]Are you ready...? Drum roll please. Brain transplantation. Some say it could never be done; 
[24]They experimented for centuries, but it turned out re-linking the brain to a foreign central nervous system was impossible. The nerve connections are far too intricate and delicate. 
[25]Dean's the only guy who really gets the science. He's the one who discovered that full brain transplantation isn't actually necessary to transfer the soul, and that partial brain transplantation solves the little nerve ending problem. 
[26]Okay so... You see the blue part? That's the piece of your brain that's all rooted in the nervous system. So that stays; keeping those tricky little connections intact. The rest is discarded. Then they'll remove the red part of my brain from my skull and put in yours. Your "blue" and my "red" basically absorb each other. And apparently the brain heals surprisingly fast, so assuming everything goes as planned, we should be up and functioning in a couple weeks. 
[27]Your red part? It'll be discarded, but don't worry. You wont be gone. Well not completely. You'll still be in there somewhere; limited consciousness of course; 
[28]you'll still be able to see and hear but your existence will be as a passenger... an audience. You will live in... 
[29]Yes. That's what she calls it. Good! So you understand, I'll control the motor functions, the will of our body, effectively 
[30]As far as the world is concerned. It's still a pretty new operation. Some kinks. We're supposed to stay away from flashes of light for example. They can trigger a "momentary lapse in control of motor functions..." 
[31]Well, because you get the highest bids. For the last decade or so anyway. I wish it was less simple than that, but it's not. You're in fashion, baby! 
[32]Honestly though, personally..? I couldn't give two shits about race. I don't care if you're black, brown, green, purple... whatever. What I want is so much deeper: Your eye, man. I want those things you see through. 
[33]Take it as a compliment. 
[34]We have and we will. We'll be together soon, brother.
dialogues.ANDRE:
[1]Damn. 
[2]Can I help you...? 
[3]I'm new to the area. I just moved here... Down on Evergreen... 
[4]This is some shit right here. 
[5]Wait a minute. I know you? You messing with me right?..Come on. 
[6]You know this could be considered stalking and harassment. Plus, you're sitting in a deadly weapon so that's some felony-type shit right there. 
[7]What?!? Say something then. 
[8]Calm down, Andre. Don't do it. Don't let him get to you. 
[9]Fuck. 
[10]I'm from Brooklyn, man. If you wanna do something, then let's do something. I'm ready..! Hey, I'm talkin' to you!!! 
[11]Shit. 
[12]
[13]Yes, of course it is. 
[14]Why, the Armitage's of course. We're friends of the family. 
[15]I'm sorry, where are my manners. Logan, Logan King. Chris was just telling me that he felt more comfortable with my being here. 
[16]Get out. 
[17]
dialogues.DETECTIVE LATOYA:
[1]...Then he should've gone back up there and made sure everything was accounted for. 
[2]`Cause hey, look; how about this? If you record the evidence, you're responsible for it. 
[3]Hello Mr... 
[4]From the TSA? 
[5]You know that TSA issues should be brought to your authorizing officer, right? 
[6]Please don't call me "ma'am," or we're not gonna get along. How can I help you, Rod Williams from the 
[7]Your son is missing? 
[8]That's four days ago. 
[9]--I'm gonna stop you right there. Now you know the minimum amount of time without contact before you can file a missing persons report 
[10]Go on. 
[11]That's Sid. 
[12]Don't look too missing to me. 
[13]Gay? 
[14]I think he might just argue with you on that one. 
[15]Try me. 
[16]...Brainwashing? 
[17]Hold on one second. Garcia, Frostie, get in here a second. I want you to tell these officers exactly what you just told me.
dialogues.ANDRE/LOGAN:
[1]Ah, well it was nice meeting you Chris. 
[2]My life as an African American has been, for the most part, very good. It's hard to be too specific as I haven't much desired to leave the house in a while. 
[3]But recently, even when you go to the city, I've just had no interest. The chores are my sanctu-- 
[4]Well, I do believe I owe you all an apology. 
[5]Well yes I am. It's quite like being trapped in a dark room and watching my experiences through a window. Thank God you and Dean were here to calm me down. 
[6]I know I scared you all quite a bit.. especially you Chris. 
[7]Of course. How could you have? 
[8]As I said I'm feeling much better now, but you'll all have to proceed without the aid of my marvellous wit; the whole thing has left me a quite a bit exhausted. 
[9]It was nice meeting you.
dialogues.TUTORIAL:
[1]Pardon me. Where is the nearest restaurant? Pardonnez-moi. Ou est le restaurant le plus proche? 
[2]Can you show me the nearest bathroom? Pouvez-vous me montrer la salle de bain la plus prouche? 
[3]Can you help me find a hotel? Pouvez-vous m'aider a trouver mon hotel? 
[4]Can you please call the police? Pouvez-vous s'il vous plait appelez la police? 
[5]I seem to have misplaced my passport. Je crois avoi egare mon passeport. 
[6]Can you direct me to the nearest hospital? Pouvez-vous me diriger vers I'hopital le plus proche? 
[7]Where is the nearest train station? Ou est la gare la plus proche? 
[8]Can you please call the police? Pouvez-vous s'il vous plait appelez la police?
dialogues.OFFICER CROWE:
[1]So in the future the number to call is Animal Control Services. 
[2]You two coming up from the city? 
[3]And what brings you up-- 
[4]You got a driver's license? 
[5]I didn't ask who was driving. I asked him for his I.D. 
[6]Ma'am, any time there is an 
[7]Yeah, I'm all good. 
[8]You guys be careful.
dialogues.GEORGINA:
[1]Hello.- 
[2]Hello. 
[3]I owe you an apology. I shouldn't be touching things that don't belong to me. 
[4]I lifted your cellular phone this morning to wipe down the dresser and it accidentally came undone, see? 
[5]Rather than meddle with it further, I left it that way. 
[6]Oh no, no, no, no, no, no... Aren't you the sweetest thing? Not at all. The Armitages are so good to us; They treat us like family. 
[7]Ahhhhh!!
dialogues.WALTER:
[1]Nothing I don't want to be doing. 
[2]I know who you are. You're Rose's friend. 
[3]She is lovely isn't she? 
[4]One of a kind; a real doggone keeper. 
[5]Sorry if I scared you last night. 
[6]And the hypnosis? Did it work? 
[7]Well, I should get back to work.
dialogues.PHIL:
[1]There you are. Here, put this somewhere. 
[2]Oh, hello. I'm Phil... and you are...? 
[3]Fantastic. Logan and I know Rose very well. 
[4]That's nice. Logan, I hate to tear you away, dear, but the Wincott's were asking about you. 
[5]We've become homebodies... 
[6]Logan? 
[7]You shouldn't have been drinking either.
dialogues.GORDON:
[1]Nice to meet you, Chris. Nice to meet you indeed. Good grip. 
[2]You ever play golf? 
[3]Can't quite swing the hips like I used to though. You know, I met Tiger. 
[4]Best I've ever seen. Ever, hands down. Let's see your form. 
[5]Show me... 
[6]If I knew what I know now at your age? Now then I could really play.
